summary: This bill, named the "Transnational Criminal Organization Illicit Spotter Prevention and Elimination Act," creates new federal crimes targeting individuals who assist in illegal border crossings. It prohibits transmitting the location or movement of law enforcement to further crimes related to immigration, customs, or controlled substances (illicit spotting), punishable by up to 10 years in prison. The bill also criminalizes the destruction of federal border controls like fences and sensors, with sentences of up to 10 years, or 20 years if a firearm is used. It also enhances penalties for using a firearm during an alien smuggling crime.
